intro: Knautia pannonica, commonly known as the Pannonian knautia, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flower clusters. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers bloom in late summer. Knautia pannonica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
